alert.note: Alert for Alfalfa; Blaine; Custer; Dewey; Major; Woods; Woodward (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued May 19 at 1:26AM CDT until May 19 at 2:30AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: The National Weather Service in Norman has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Woods County in northwestern Oklahoma... Northeastern Custer County in western Oklahoma... Alfalfa County in northwestern Oklahoma... Blaine County in northwestern Oklahoma... Eastern Dewey County in northwestern Oklahoma... Major County in northwestern Oklahoma... Southeastern Woodward County in northwestern Oklahoma... * Until 230 AM CDT. * At 126 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 11 miles south of Aetna to 7 miles west of Waynoka to 6 miles north of Chester to 7 miles west of Putnam, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. * Locations impacted include... Watonga, Alva, Fairview, Cherokee, Taloga, Helena, Okeene, Thomas, Waynoka, Seiling, Canton, Ringwood, Custer City, Carmen, Cleo Springs, Longdale, Goltry, Ames, Meno and Jet. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: Prepare immediately for large hail and damaging winds. People outside should move immediately to shelter inside a strong building. Stay away from windows. Large hail and damaging winds and continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning.

area.areaDesc: Alfalfa; Blaine; Custer; Dewey; Major; Woods; Woodward
